## Public Member Functions

### enterRegion() {#a0fdf731113f2b02fd779a07e4d433717}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void GCNIterativeScheduler::enterRegion (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; bb, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> begin, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> end, unsigned regioninstrs)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Initialize the DAG and common scheduler state for a new scheduling region.

This does not actually create the DAG, only clears it. The scheduling driver may call BuildSchedGraph multiple times per scheduling region.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-h/#l00045">45</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-h">GCNIterativeScheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-cpp/#l00278">278</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-cpp">GCNIterativeScheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### finalizeSchedule() {#a9d0ff8af24f7c66a107ce5695a1149dd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void GCNIterativeScheduler::finalizeSchedule ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Allow targets to perform final scheduling actions at the level of the whole <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a>.

By default does nothing.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-h/#l00050">50</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-h">GCNIterativeScheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-cpp/#l00302">302</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-cpp">GCNIterativeScheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### schedule() {#ab201710a9597b0df54c12a848d4804d9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void GCNIterativeScheduler::schedule ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Orders nodes according to selected style.

Typically, a scheduling algorithm will implement <a href="#ab201710a9597b0df54c12a848d4804d9">schedule()</a> without overriding <a href="#a0fdf731113f2b02fd779a07e4d433717">enterRegion()</a> or <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledaginstrs/#abc5a5c32ac78a99ee2633dbbeec20397">exitRegion()</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-h/#l00043">43</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-h">GCNIterativeScheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-cpp/#l00291">291</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcniterativescheduler-cpp">GCNIterativeScheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
